content.text: WE BEGIN ON A COMIC.
The cover asks WHO IS SPIDER-MAN?

dialogue: Alright, let’s do this one last time. My name is Peter Parker.

content.text: QUICK CUTS of a BLOND PETER PARKER
Pulling down his mask...a name tag that reads “Peter Parker”...various shots of Spider-Man IN ACTION.

dialogue: I was bitten by a radioactive spider and for ten years I’ve been the one and only Spider-Man. I’m pretty sure you know the rest.

content.text: UNCLE BEN tells Peter:

dialogue: With great power comes great responsibility.

content.text: Uncle Ben walks into the beyond.

dialogue: I saved a bunch of people, fell in love, saved the city, and then I saved the city again and again and again...

content.text: Spiderman saves the city, kisses MJ, saves the city some more. The shots evoke ICONIC SPIDER-MAN IMAGES, but each one is subtly different, somehow altered.
Cut to Spider-Man dancing on the street, exactly like in the movie Spider-Man 3.

dialogue: We don’t really talk about this.

content.text: A THREE PANEL SPLIT SCREEN: shots of Spider-Man’s “products”:

dialogue: Look, I’m a comic book, I’m a cereal, did a Christmas album. I have an excellent theme song.
And a so-so popsicle. I mean, I’ve looked worse.

content.text: MATCH CUT -- Peter, PINNED to a WALL by a mechanical tentacle arm. KINGPIN punches Peter. GREEN GOBLIN fights Peter.

dialogue: But after everything, I still love being Spider-Man. I mean, who wouldn’t?

content.text: Peter runs toward a SUPER-COLLIDER, something we’ll see quite soon. Peter SLAMMED TO THE GROUND.

dialogue: So no matter how many hits I take, I always find a way to come back.

content.text: Peter GETS UP... in a shot that we will also remember, RIGHT BEFORE GOBLIN GRABS HIM.
The collider EXPLOLDING, the force of the blast rippling through New York.

dialogue: Because the only thing standing between this city and oblivion is me. There’s only one Spider-Man. And you’re looking at him.

content.text: Spider-Man WINKS. Man, he’s cool.
SMASH CUT:
SEQ. 0150 - MEET MILES MORALES “MMM”
MILES MORALES draws HOME-MADE STREET ART NAME-TAGS at a desk, headphones on, singing along to a song he’s too young for (”Sunflower”), but he doesn’t quite know the words yet.
A PHOTO of a YOUNGER MILES with his PARENTS and his UNCLE AARON visible in the background--
--Miles WHIPS OFF his headphones--

dialogue: Are you finished packing for school?
Yeah! Just ironing my last shirt!

content.text: Reveal his EMPTY BAG. He is NOT PACKED. He’s been AVOIDING IT.
--He FLIES around the room, tossing VARIOUS ITEMS into the suitcase, throwing on a BLUE UNIFORM JACKET, the camera catching other childhood details--

dialogue: C’mon, you a grown man now! Let show these teachers that. Let’s go!

content.text: BAM! The door flies open. FAST-PACED, Miles enters the living room, where his parents get ready for the day.

dialogue: --If you want me to drive you we gotta go now--
Ay Maria, este nene me tiene loca!

content.text: Miles grabs food. Mom and dad frantically cross behind him.
Rio SMOTHERS an embarrassed Miles with kisses. Miles rolls his eyes, hates it/loves it.
Miles rolls his bag down the steps as Rio calls out:
Miles struggles down the street with the heavy bag, but he’s in his element. He walks by his old school, BROOKLYN MIDDLE - passes some OLD FRIENDS, who he loves and misses.

dialogue: Ohhhhh. Look who’s back! Yo what’s going on, bro?--
--Hey, I’m just walking by, how you doing?--
Yo, Miles did you feel that earthquake last night?
What are you talking about? I slept like a baby last night.
You miss me? I still live here! Wait, you miss me?

content.text: TIME CUT: Miles RUNS DOWN THE STREET, SLAPS his HOMEMADE STICKERS on some things, ends by SLAPPING a STOP SIGN, making a LOUD CLANG--
--but he trips on his shoe laces and falls into the street--
--POLICE LIGHTS FLASH along with the signature BWOOP BWOOP.
SEQ. 0425 - SITTING BACK THERE “SBT”
The POLICE CAR moves through the neighborhood. Miles is in the back seat. 1010 WINS plays.

dialogue: Seriously, Dad, walking would have been fine.

content.text: Reveal Jefferson driving. Miles' dad is a COP!

dialogue: You can walk plenty on Saturday when you peel those stickers off.
You saw that? I don’t know if that was me, Dad.
And the two from yesterday on Clinton.

content.text: Jefferson stares, shuts down the cheekiness. Miles looks hurt. Jefferson clocks his pained look. It bums Jefferson out. There’s an awkwardness between Miles and his dad that's not there with his mom.
They drive by a row of HIPSTER COFFEE SHOPS. Jefferson tries to bridge the gap with Miles, more cheerful:

dialogue: Soooo... look at that, another new coffee shop... you see that Miles?
--You see that one, what’s that one called?
Foam Party, come on...and everyone is just lining up! You see that, Miles--
Is that a coffee shop or a disco?
There are multiple reports of another mysterious seismic event last night. Sources close to Spider- Man say he is looking into the problem.

content.text: Jefferson shakes his head, disapproving, turns off the radio.

dialogue: Spider-Man. I mean this guy swings in once a day zip zap zop in his little mask and answers to no one, right?
And meanwhile my guys are out there, lives on the line--

content.text: SCHOOL KIDS run alongside the car looking at Miles, who slinks down. They bang on the window, teasing Miles, “you get arrested?!”

dialogue: --no masks, we show our faces. Accountability.
--Oh no! Dad, speed up, I know these kids--
--You know, with great ability comes great accountability--
That’s not even how the saying goes, Dad--
--I do like his cereal though, I’ll give him that--

content.text: Jeff stops the car. The teens reach Miles’ window.

dialogue: --Oh my gosh. Don’t cops run red lights?
Some do... but not your Dad!

content.text: The car drives up right under the Brooklyn Bridge, to a school overlooking MANHATTAN, which LOOMS across the water.
The car pulls up. Miles sits, not wanting to go in.

dialogue: Why can’t I go back to Brooklyn Middle?
Miles, you’ve given it two weeks. We’re not having this conversation.
--I just think that this new school is elitist--
--and I would prefer to be at a normal school among the people.
The people? These are your people!
--I'm only here ‘cause I won that stupid lottery--
No way. You passed the entry test just like everybody else, ok! You have an opportunity here, you wanna blow that, huh? You want to end up like your Uncle?
--What’s wrong with Uncle Aaron? He’s a good guy--

content.text: --Jefferson FLINCHES, angered. Reins it in.

dialogue: --It doesn't feel like I have a choice right now--

content.text: Tension fills the car. They sit in silence for a beat.
Miles gets out of the car and opens the front door to get his bag  Jefferson staring through his rearview mirror--

dialogue: Yeah, I know, Dad. See you Friday--

content.text: --Miles shuts the door and walks away. Jefferson watches, bummed at the state of the relationship. He lifts his P.A.

dialogue: You gotta say I love you back.
You wanna hear me say it--
--You’re dropping me off at a school--
That’s a copy. Tie your shoes please!

content.text: SEQ. 0200 - THE LOTTERY WINNER “TLW”
PAN UP from UNTIED SHOES -- Miles clocks them but defiantly DOES NOT TIE THEM--
--Miles walks through a LOBBY filled with TALLER KIDS in IDENTICAL BLUE UNIFORMS. A cutting-edge LAB SCHOOL in a converted industrial building.
In a SEA OF BLUE, Miles awkwardly tries to interact like he was on his street but everyone's so focused.

dialogue: Hey good morning. How you doing?... Weekend was short, huh?
Oh my gosh this is embarrassing, we wore the same jacket--

content.text: MILES P.O.V. -- The UNIFORMED KIDS just pass by. Miles is discouraged.

dialogue: Yeah, I’m aware. It’s a choice.

content.text: And as his SHOULDERS DROOP he turns to walk into--
--A MATH TEACHER in front of a BAFFLING FORMULA.
--A LOGIC TEACHER in front of an ELABORATE PROOF.

dialogue: --And that is known as a syllogism.

content.text: --IN JUMPCUTS Miles walks back and forth across the hallway. Each time he is holding more paper and books in his arms, getting more and more WEIGHED DOWN.

dialogue: --Tonight, read two chapters of Great Expectations--
--I’m giving you a take-home quiz on volumetric pressure--
--a five page essay with your conclusions stressed--
Workers Party/ Take-home Work/ Industrial Revolution/ Incapable/ An enormous change/ Unstoppable--

content.text: --The MONTAGE BUILDS, a MULTI-PANELLED FLURRY--
PRELAP: A BELL RINGS
He runs through the EMPTYING HALLWAYS. END MONTAGE.
Students sit in a DARKENED CLASSROOM, lit only by a large screen playing a DOCUMENTARY.

dialogue: --countless other possibilities. There could be a universe where I am wearing red. Or wearing leather pants--

content.text: The door BURSTS OPEN -- MILES, out of breath, is silhouetted in the doorway.
The TEACHER FLIPS THE LIGHTS on. STUDENTS blink in the bright light and grumble.

dialogue: Mr. Morales, moving in the dark. You’re late again.
Einstein said time was relative, right? Maybe I’m not late. Maybe you guys are early.

content.text: Miles’ joke is met with unamused SILENCE. Except for a single TITTER from a NEW GIRL.

dialogue: Sorry. It was just so quiet.
Would you like to keep standing there or do you want to sit down?

content.text: Someone HITS THE LIGHTS. In the dark, Miles awkwardly makes his way to his seat, BANGS into a desk in the dark.
Onscreen is a PHYSICIST, identified as “Director, Alchemax Laboratories.” She’s the consummate nerd and AMPED about physics.

dialogue: Our universe is in fact one of many parallel universes happening at the exact same time. Thanks to everyone here at the Fisk Family Foundation for the Sciences, I will prove they exist when I build my supercollider. All I need is 10 billion dollars. Chump change, right?

content.text: ON MILES, he BONKS INTO THE DESK of a NEW GIRL, paying rapt attention and sits down at the desk beside her.
Miles checks out the girl, who catches him looking. Miles looks away. Looks back -- she’s still looking.

dialogue: I mean, it wasn’t funny, that’s why I laughed. But it was smart, so I liked it.
I don’t think I’ve seen you before--

content.text: --Ms. Calleros SHUSHES Miles, cutting him off.
Miles sits -- checks out the new girl but she’s again focussed on the documentary. Miles is INTRIGUED.

dialogue: Every choice that we make, would create countless other possibilities. A What-if to infinity.

content.text: Miles stands in front of Ms. Calleros’ desk as she slides a zero with a 0/100 written on it.

dialogue: A zero? A few more of those and you probably have to kick me outta here huh? Maybe I’m just not right for this school?
If a person wearing a blind fold picked the answers on a true or false quiz at random, do you know what score they would get?

The only way to get all the answers wrong, is to know which answers were right. You’re trying to quit. And I’m not going to let you. I’m assigning you a personal essay. Not about physics, but about you and what kind of person you want to be.

content.text: Miles stares at his STACK OF HOMEWORK. He takes out a legal pad to start on his Great Expectations paper. He sighs.
Frustrated, Miles looks out the window for a beat.
Miles SMILES -- he has a MISCHIEVOUS IDEA.
SEQ. 0500 - A NIGHT WITH AARON “NWA”
Miles moves down a street, alive with nighttime city energy. Once again the CAREFREE kid he yearns to be. Moving AWAY from the Manhattan skyline and turning into--
--AN ALLEY, where he sees a light on in the top apartment.
UNCLE AARON is texting on his couch when he receives a picture text of him, texting, from 1 second ago. Uncle Aaron looks at his window and sees Miles--

dialogue: Uncle Aaroooooon! Hey! Were you scared?!

content.text: Miles PRESSES HIS FACE UP AGAINST THE WINDOW making a funny face.
TIME CUT  -- Aaron washes dishes as Miles SPARS with Aaron’s PUNCHING BAG not-very-competently:

dialogue: You want that, huh? Unh. Unh.
Going great. Got tons of friends.
You can't tell me it’s all that bad there... smart girls is where it’s at. Place must be full of 'em.

content.text: Aaron walks over to the punching bag and holds it for Miles.

dialogue: No, there’s no one. There’s no one.

content.text: Aaron walks over to the microwave to get some popcorn.

dialogue: ...Yo I cannot have a nephew of mine on the streets with no game.
There was a new girl, actually, she's kinda into me. You know how it is.

content.text: Miles sits on the couch, and SCRIBBLES in his notebook.

dialogue: --You know we... this is... we’re laying down the ground work right now.

content.text: Uncle Aaron reacts, amused by Miles effort to sound cool.

dialogue: You know about the shoulder touch?
Of course I do! But tell me anyway.
Tomorrow find that girl, walk up to her and be like...
I'm telling you man, it's science.
So walk up to her and be like... hey.
No no no no... like hey...
You sure you’re my nephew, man?

content.text: Miles’ phone vibrates.
Miles has a text from Dad: “Done with that homework?”

dialogue: I should probably go. Still got a paper to do tonight.

content.text: Aaron sees this text and then casually but deliberately changes the subject to Miles’ drawings in his notebook.

dialogue: --Yo, you’ve been holding out on me. You throw these up yet?
No, man, you know my dad. I can’t.

content.text: --Aaron stands. He crosses out of frame, Miles getting EXCITED--

dialogue: C’mon. I got a spot you ain’t gonna believe.
I can’t! I can’t I can’t--

content.text: Miles and Aaron make their way out of a subway car and wait for it to clear.

dialogue: I’m gonna get in so much trouble.
Hey man, tell them your art teacher made you.
Hey, how did you know about this place?
Did an engineering job down here.

content.text: SEQ. 0520 - SUBWAY SPIDER BITE “SSB”

Aaron and Miles walk deeper and deeper down the tunnels and approach an ELECTRIFIED floor-to-ceiling FENCE. RACK TO an AlCHEMAX PRIVATE PROPERTY SIGN, and other HIGH SECURITY PARAPHERNALIA. Someone really wants people to stay out.
Aaron expertly CLIMBS A FENCE, drops down on the other side.
Miles climbs the fence. We STAY ON AARON as we hear Miles struggle. Finally Miles lands next to Aaron.
Uncle Aaron laughs.

dialogue: Yeah man I knew we were related.

content.text: Aaron leads Miles into a huge space. Empty walls and spiderwebs as far as the eye can see.
The room is full of BEAUTIFUL STREET ART -- it’s a secret spot.

dialogue: There’s a lot of history on these walls.

content.text: Aaron gestures to a wall that’s been RECENTLY CLEANED AND PREPPED...clearly by Aaron.
Aaron smiles, leans down to his BAG and unzips it, revealing KRYLON SPRAY PAINT CANS. He tosses a can to Miles. Presses PLAY on a stereo. Miles SMILES--
--and starts painting. Aaron turns over a BENCH.

dialogue: Now you’re on your own, Miles.
Whoa, slow down a little... that's better... that’s perfect.

content.text: Unbeknownst to them, a faintly glowing SPIDER descends on a web, towards the ground and towards the cans!

dialogue: The real Miles, comin’ out of hiding. Now you can cut that line with another color. That’s it...

content.text: CUT TO Miles on Uncle Aaron’s shoulders. For a beat afterward, they paint TOGETHER.

dialogue: You want drips? ‘Cause if you do, that’s cool, but if you don’t you gotta keep it moving...

content.text: Aaron traces Miles’ silhouette on the wall.
Miles steps back, admiring his work. A STRIKING PIECE, built around Miles silouette with nothing painted inside it. A BLANK. “No Expectations” written above.

dialogue: No man. Miles I see exactly what you’re doing here, man.

content.text: Miles smiles. So happy to finally be seen.

dialogue: Yeah. You know me and your Dad used to do this back in the day.
It’s true. Then he took on the cop thing... and I don’t know. He’s a good guy, just... you know what I’m saying...

content.text: Aaron’s phone VIBRATES, he READS a message. A shadow across his face.

dialogue: All right, come on man. I gotta roll.

content.text: Aaron walks out of the tunnel leaving Miles alone. Miles takes one last look at their PAINTING and takes a picture of it on his phone.
There's the SPIDER, on the back of Miles’ hand. It BITES him!
WE JUMP INTO PSYCHEDELIC 2D ANIMATION, watching the VENOM make it’s way into MILES’ BLOOD STREAM, BUILDING UNTIL--
--Miles flicks the spider and it falls off his hand.
Miles, hiding the bite, runs to join his Uncle.
SEQ. 0700 - PUBERTY “PUB”
TIME LAPSE: As the moon rises, Miles shifts positions. It’s a restless sleep, the spider-bite faintly glows, Miles starts to sweat...
While Miles tosses and turns, his roomate Ganke works on his computer, taking a break to read “The True Life Tales of Spider-Man” comic book.
Miles gets up and puts his pants on. They are too short.
The words "that's weird" are VISUALIZED onscreen. Miles looks up, SURPRISED by the sound of his own Spider-Man voice-over.
Ganke stops typing at this laptop, eyes wide. He quickly resumes his work as the words “I should have kept that to myself” appear thought-bubbled next to Miles.
SEQ. 0730 - WHY AM I SO SWEATY? “SWT”
Miles walks the halls, awkwardly trying to pull down his pants that are now suddenly too short for him. As he speaks HIS THOUGHTS APPEAR IN THREE DIMENSIONAL SPACE BEHIND HIM.

dialogue: I gotta get new pants. Wait, why is the voice in my head so loud?

content.text: --His strut is interrupted by a high-pitched WHINE that STOPS when he bumps into the NEW GIRL FROM PHYSICS CLASS.

dialogue: It's a puberty thing. I don't know why I said that. I’m not going through puberty. I did. But I’m done.
--So you're, like, new here, right? We got that in common.
Yes, it’s African. I'm South African. No accent though, cause I was raised here.

content.text: Gwanda continues, though her voice FADES AWAY...

dialogue: Do the shoulder touch now! Before she walks away!

content.text: In SLOW MOTION, Miles' hand heads toward Gwanda's shoulder as she watches its slow, deliberate journey.

dialogue: Why is this so scary? Am I doing this in slow motion or does it just feel that way?
...I'm kidding. It's Wanda. No G. That's crazy.

content.text: The hand lands. Beat.

dialogue: OK then. I’ll see you around.

content.text: Miles is mortified. Wanda turns to leave but is jerked back by Miles.

dialogue: --Hey! Um, can you let go please? Ow ow ow ow ow, calm down, it’s fine--

content.text: Miles is STUCK to her. He tries to unstick himself but it keeps getting worse. Now Wanda's hair is involved.

dialogue: I'm working on it. It's just puberty!
I don’t think you know what puberty is! Just relax.
I’m going to pull REALLY hard.

content.text: Wanda finally has enough and FLIPS Miles, in full view of dozens of students. Miles SCREAMS.
Pre-lap: An electric razor BUZZES.
Miles looks on as his hand is freed from Wanda’s hair. Miles’ expression tells us her hair is ravaged. And it is.
She won’t even look at him.
Exiting, Miles balls his hair-covered hands and puts them in his pockets. He walks the halls, mortified.

dialogue: No one saw. It’s ok. No one knows. No one knows.

content.text: The sentence “EVERYONE KNOWS” appears behind him, giant letters. The period appears last like a CANNONBALL.

dialogue: They’re talking about me. They saw everything. He knows. She knows. They know.
Wow. She's super tall. Why is he smiling? Am I the weird guy now? What am I doing? How do I stop? Can they hear my thoughts? Why are all my thoughts so loud?!

content.text: The SCHOOL SECURITY GUARD appears--

dialogue: --Hey! I know you snuck out last night, Morales.

content.text: SEQ. 0790 - SPIDER-MAN SYMPTOMS “SMS”
--Panicking, Miles TAKES OFF RUNNING.
Miles rounds a corner and runs down the hall trying.
He finds an open door and runs into:
Miles slams the door behind him.

dialogue: You’re okay. You’re okay. You’re okay. He’ll never find you.

content.text: He SPINS to LOOK AROUND THE OFFICE, and sees, to his horror, a PHOTO OF THE SECURITY GUARD AND HIS BUDDIES.
The guard reaches the door, starts to bang. We now see the sign on the door: SECURITY OFFICE.
INSIDE THE OFFICE
Miles is stuck, yanking on the door. His HAND pulls away, ripping off the DOOR'S VENEER.
He stands, his hands sticking to his shirt and accidentally YANKING IT OVER HIS EYES.

dialogue: What are you doing in my office Morales?! Morales! Open up!

content.text: Unable to see he RUNS DIRECTLY INTO A BOOKSHELF, then sticks to it, pulling it down IN FRONT OF THE DOOR. He hits the laptop and Spider-man’s Christmas song (”Spidey Bells”) starts to play.
Outside in the hallway, the security guard notices the kids reacting to the song playing from his office.
--Miles TRIPS and ROLLS UP THE WALL -- circling the four walls like a dervish, he sticks to the ceiling and “break dances.”
He falls onto a DESK CHAIR and then ROLLS OUT THE WINDOW!
OUTSIDE THE BUILDING
Miles sticks straight out his window sill, sticky feet the only thing preventing him from falling down.
Miles struggles to get inside. He rolls onto an ADJACENT WINDOW where A FULL CLASSROOM of TRANSFIXED STUDENTS doesn’t notice the horrified Miles on the window--

dialogue: ....what Hofstadter is suggesting... is that we... look underneath...

content.text: --Miles rolls AROUND THE BUILDING, rounding a corner -- Suddenly BIRDS fly into him, and somehow become STUCK TO HIS HANDS as they FLAP WILDLY, PECKING AT HIS EYES--
INSIDE THE GLASS HALLWAY, we find WANDA, watching Miles, a little perplexed.
BACK WITH MILES, rounding a corner-- He’s back at his dorm room!
IN HIS ROOM, Miles makes his way through his window to the FLOOR. He looks up, breath heaving as a SPIDER-MAN COMIC floats down onto his face. (The True Life Tales of Spider- Man)

Miles lifts the comic -- it rips a bit -- and looks at it. The two-page spread contains panels IDENTICAL TO WHAT MILES JUST EXPERIENCED: A Spider bite. Peter Parker pulling on the door ("Why is this happening?", “Please stop sticking!”), rolling out the window, and finally lying the floor, exactly where Miles is.

dialogue: How could there be two Spider-Men? There can’t be two Spider-Men.

content.text: SEQ. 1100 - I DON’T WANT TO BE A SUPERHERO “IDW”
SPLASH PAGE:      THE TWO SPIDER-MEN
stories up. The REAL SPIDER-MAN is his reflection, but he’s bigger and cooler looking.
Miles races down the street. A phone RINGS.

dialogue: Come on Uncle Aaron. Pick up. Pick up.
--Yo, it’s Aaron. I'm outta town for a few days. Hit you when I'm back. Peace.

content.text: His thoughts racing in V.O.:
--The THOUGHT BUBBLE “NO’S” FLY OFF BEHIND HIM--

dialogue: It's just puberty, it’s a normal spider, and I'm a normal kid--

content.text: --SCREEEEEEEEECCCHHH!!!!  Miles races into the path of an ONCOMING CAR, but reflexes kick in and he VAULTS over it -- an INSANE SUPER-HEROIC leap that lands him twenty feet away. AMAZED PASSERSBY CHEER.
Miles continues on, more freaked out than ever.
SEQ. 1150 - BACK THROUGH THE TUNNELS “BTT”
ONSCREEN COMIC BOOK BOXES: “Later...Miles searches for answers...”
Miles rides the subway.
He scrolls to his DAD’s number. He thinks to himself for a beat, then DECIDES AGAINST IT.
He exits the subway, turns toward the DARK TUNNEL he and Uncle Aaron walked into.

dialogue: You’re being crazy Miles. You’re being crazy.

content.text: The MURAL Miles made is still here.
The DEAD SPIDER is there. Miles flips it over. It looks WEIRD and FLUORESCENT.

dialogue: It's a normal spider. It’s like boring how normal the spider is...

content.text: The spider GLITCHES making Miles jump back.
Suddenly, Miles hears a RUMBLE. He stands, STARTLED. The rumble STOPS. It appears to be coming from a PITCH BLACK ABANDONED TUNNEL. A surge of SPIDER-SENSE. Overwhelming.

dialogue: Why is this happening to me?

content.text: SEQ. 1200 - ASSEMBLY ROOM FIGHT “ARF”
Miles shines his light into darkness. This is SCARY. A LONG, BLUE TUBE, stamped ALCHEMAX, arcs into the DISTANCE, HUMMING. Miles’ spider-sense continues to direct him.
Another surge of SPIDER-SENSE hits Miles and we hear competing thoughts in his head.

dialogue: Slow down!/What am I doing? What am I doing?

content.text: Miles picks up the pace, jogs around the corner, where Miles TURNS, a BIG SURGE OF SPIDER-SENSE and multiple voices are heard together--

dialogue: Look out./I don’t want to be a hero!/Look out.

content.text: --WHAM!!!!! A SUBWAY CAR flies towards him from the next room and SMASHES AGAINST THE WALL BESIDE HIM!
A massive staging room containing Alchemax EQUIPMENT.
ZOOM IN ON: SPIDER-MAN. In mid-flight. Backwards. He wrecks against some painful looking equipment.
ON MILES, TERRIFIED. What's happening?!

dialogue: I cannot let you open a portal to another dimension! Brooklyn is not zoned for that!

content.text: PAN to reveal GREEN GOBLIN, a 25' beast with massive wings. He unfurls a big BIG BLUE TONGUE.

dialogue: I don’t know I guess I like Brooklyn not being sucked into a black hole?

content.text: As Miles turns to run, A GIANT BEAM CRASHES INTO THE ROOM. Miles FALLS ON TOP OF IT as it swings back out into the room where Goblin and Spider-Man are FIGHTING. Miles hangs onto the beam for dear life.
Miles is tossed around the room as Goblin and Spider-Man battle.
Green Goblin throws CLUSTER BOMBS as Spider-man swings around them, and Miles avoids the explosion but now he's EXPOSED. This is WAY more real in person.
He runs down a MASSIVE HALLWAY, away from the battle. Miles catches himself before tumbling over the end of the hallway into a giant room.
SEQ. 1210 - MEET KINGPIN “MKP”
He is now in an ENORMOUS CHAMBER containing a SUPERCOLLIDER.
Miles looks around the room, confused.
--Spider-Man and Goblin BURST through doors above him--
--Miles falls STRAIGHT DOWN, but Spidey spots Miles and--
--swings him safely away, high and far from the action. They are on an OBSERVATION LEDGE overlooking the collider chamber.
A beat as they appraise each other. Then:

dialogue: Did you know your shoes are untied?
This is a onesie so I don’t really have to worry about it.

content.text: A beat. Spidey senses something in Miles. Their spider-senses RESONATE. Like a mind meld.

dialogue: I thought I was the only one. You’re like me.
I don’t think you have a choice, kiddo.
Got a lot going through your head, I’m sure.
You’re gonna be fine. I can help you. If you stick around, I can show you the ropes.
I just need to destroy this big machine real quick before the space time continuum collapses. Don’t move. See you in a bit--

content.text: --IN AN AMAZING, MIND-BOGGLING MOVE, Spidey jumps away and uses the MASSIVE CHURNING SUPERCOLLIDER to WHIP HIMSELF UP until he’s ON THE CEILING, hundreds of yards above, and eye- level with a CEILING PANEL.
He RIPS THE PANEL OUT, reaches in, pulling out COMPLICATED WIRING.  He pulls a STRANGE COMPUTERIZED KEY out of his suit and tries to plug it INTO A HANGING PORT. Miles watches, IMPRESSED.
Spider-Man tries to put the key in the port, but it’s the wrong side, he flips it around, that’s wrong too somehow.
As he finally gets it-- a SURGE OF SPIDER-SENSE--
--A PURPLE BLUR streaks overhead. TWO PUNCHES from nowhere. Dazed, Spider-Man looks up and sees a lanky opponent in a purple MASK and SUIT wearing mechanized GLOVES and BOOTS. It's THE PROWLER.
As they FLY ACROSS THE ROOM, FIGHTING--

dialogue: Prowler! Man, I was in the middle of something!

content.text: Prowler THROWS HIM HARD TO THE GROUND.
Prowler lunges towards Spider-Man but Spider-Man expertly dodges the claws and spinning rocket boot kicks--

dialogue: Are you mad at me? I feel like you’re mad at me.

content.text: Miles watches from down below, helpless. He SNAPS a picture on his cell phone.
--The GREEN GOBLIN appears and pins Spider-Man to the ground. His giant blue tongue lashes around angrily, hitting Spider- Man with GIANT GOBS OF SPIT.

dialogue: I should go up there and help him! Who am I kidding, I should not do that.

content.text: PRELAP: THE SOUND OF LOUD, DELIBERATE FOOTSTEPS. THE CLICKING OF A PEN.
TERRIFIED SCIENTISTS work as SOMETHING HUGE walks through the room from behind them.
REVEAL KINGPIN, an elaborately-tailored HULK OF A MAN. He walks through the control room towards the windows that face out over the collider room.

dialogue: Dooby do, dooby do. Watch out, here comes the spider-man!
You like my new toy? It cost me a fortune. But hey, you can’t take it with you, right? You came all this way. Watch the test. It’s a hell of a freakin’ light show, you’re gonna love this.
No! No! Don’t do this! Stop! You don’t know what it can do, it’ll kill us all!

content.text: The collider ROARS ON, lights MOVING UP THE WALLS toward the top, as it CRESCENDOES WITH-- CLUNK! A TINY ATMOSPHERIC METER in a BOX lowers down, blinking, with a TINNY WHIR...
Spider-Man confused as--the SENSOR LOCKS INTO PLACE.
--BLAM! The collider behind Spidey ACTIVATES, firing PARTICLE BEAMS at the BOX, which FREAKS OUT, it’s readings ON HAYWIRE. IT’S CRAZY LOOKING.
Kingpin watches, a huge smile. A DREAM COMING TRUE. The scientists are growing EXCITED--
A Brooklynite looks up from a quivering latte at FOAM PARTY...

A minor EARTHQUAKE shakes Brooklyn. But this is no ordinary earthquake. Weird colors, weird blurring. 25 TRAFFIC LIGHTS vibrating in the same space. 25 DIFFERENT-LOOKING CHRYSLER BUILDINGS vibrating in the same space. As we’ll later learn this is a “dimensional quake.” Very dangerous. But it looks COOL.
INSIDE THE COLLIDER ROOM
Spider-Man struggles as Goblin continues to hold him onto the ground. The ceiling tiles begin to shake, falling onto Goblin- -

dialogue: Norm, what’s your take on head trauma?

content.text: Spidey jumps towards the collider. BUT--
Goblin rises, flies, then GRABS Spider-Man and SHOVES HIM into the beam/tiny portal. The beam now OUT OF CONTROL.

dialogue: Goblin, no! Get him out of there!

content.text: Uh Oh. Goblin pushes Spidey's head INTO THE BEAM.
PETER'S POV -- PSYCHEDELIC LIGHTS and UNDULATING THREADS. We don’t know it yet but we are seeing a portal to the multiverse. SPIDEY starts to GLITCH STRANGELY--
--Spidey regains control, PULLING GOBLIN into the beam then A HUGE ENERGY PULSE BURSTS OUT FROM THE COLLIDER, knocking everyone back!
OUTSIDE, the PULSE WHOOSHES THROUGH THE CITY, KNOCKING THE LIGHTS OUT TEMPORARILY--
SEQ. 1220 - DEATH OF SPIDER-MAN “DOS”
The PULSE wrecks the chamber. Miles has FALLEN THROUGH A HOLE IN THE FLOOR, smoke billowing everywhere.
Miles scrambles by the remains of Green Goblin, crushed by some heavy machinery: DEAD.
--Miles reaches A very injured SPIDER-MAN.

dialogue: I’m fine, I’m fine. Just resting.
Yeah, yeah I always get up...
The coughing’s probably not a good sign.

content.text: NOISES FROM ABOVE, shadows. Kingpin’s thugs have discovered the hole.

dialogue: Listen, we gotta team up here, we don’t have that much time...

content.text: --Spider-Man hands the SHUTDOWN KEY to Miles--

dialogue: This override key is the only way to stop the collider. Swing up there, use this key, push the button, and blow it up.

content.text: Spider-Man swallows hard, his breath shallower, his voice FAST. This is serious--

dialogue: You need to hide your face. You don’t tell anyone who you are. No one can know. He’s got everyone in his pocket--
If he turns the machine on again, everything you know will disappear. Your family, everyone -- everyone. Promise me you’ll do this.
--Go! Destroy the collider. I’ll come and find you... it’s going to be ok.

content.text: --Miles CLAMBERS UP A DEBRIS PILE TO THE FLOOR ABOVE--
Miles peeks up to the top of the collider... IT’S SO FAR UP THERE. Down below the conversation continues. Kingpin enters:

dialogue: Tombstone. We’re done with tests. Get that thing ready to go again.

content.text: The scientist BACKS AWAY, runs. Kingpin shakes his head.

dialogue: Run faster. These guys are weak.

content.text: Kingpin approaches Spider-Man.

dialogue: I’d say it’s nice to see you again, Spider-Man. But it’s not.

content.text: Kingpin takes off Spider-Man's mask.
It's Peter Parker, 26 years old. BLONDE.

dialogue: This might open a black hole under Brooklyn. It can’t be worth the risk.
It's not always about the money, Spider-Man.

content.text: Prowler APPEARS FROM THE DARKNESS, advances on Peter--

dialogue: --Don’t you want to know what I saw in there?

content.text: Kingpin’s hand raises. Prowler HALTS.

dialogue: I know what you’re trying to do. And it won’t work. They’re gone.

content.text: A flash of FURY and Kingpin delivers the DEATH BLOW himself. A long beat.
ON MILES, eyes widening. Miles moves slightly and makes DEBRIS fall.
They follow the noise up to MILES' SILHOUETTED FIGURE...
Miles RUNS. The Prowler takes off after Miles.
SEQ. 1240 - PROWLER CHASES MILES “PCM”
--Miles races down the tunnel toward the LIGHT OF THE STATION. He HOPS THE FENCE, no hesitation.
Prowler sprints behind with INFRARED VISION!
A SUBWAY TRAIN IS COMING! Miles LEAPS INTO THE AIR and GRABS THE CEILING as the DEAFENING subway passes BENEATH HIM.
Prowler WALKS TOWARD MILES as Miles realizes his HANDS ARE STUCK! Miles swings his legs around to free himself as Prowler approaches. A nightmare come to life.
Miles somehow RIPS HIS HANDS OFF, skin tearing -- OW! -- and races out of the tunnel--
INTO THE LIGHT, clambering onto the PLATFORM, another train coming, Miles LEAPS, just CLEARING IT. He runs upstairs. Prowler watches from the SHADOWY TUNNEL, unable to follow.

dialogue: Stand clear of the closing doors, please.

content.text: Prowler whizzes through the busy streets on his motorcycle. He drives right by a hiding Miles.
Miles runs past a crowd that is gathering around the strange CLUSTERED TRAFFIC LIGHT we saw earlier(A remnant of dimensional glitching), taking photos.

dialogue: Yeah, I think it’s a Banksy.

content.text: SEQ. 1250 - JUST KID STUFF “JKS”
Off screen, a TV plays the news as MILES climbs through the window.

dialogue: ...New Yorkers are reporting sporadic power outages in the wake of another strange seismic event...

content.text: He's breathing heavy. He's freaked out and so scared. JEFF'S VOICE rings out from O.S.

dialogue: Police! Put your hands up!! ..Miles? Miles?

content.text: Jefferson sees Miles.
--Miles runs up to his dad and embraces him. Jeff is confused, then seems to get it.

dialogue: Miles? Que te pasa? Is it the earthquake?

content.text: Miles looks at each of his parents, torn. Maybe he should confide in them...?

dialogue: Miles, it’s a weeknight. You made a commitment to that school--

content.text: Rio and Jeff share a look. Jeff understands, softens.
Miles sits down on his bed.
--Rio shoves Jeff out--

dialogue: --What? He asked me. Baby, you know how I feel about Spider-Man, c’mon...

content.text: Jeff leaves. Miles, lies down on his bed. Rio tenderly strokes Miles’ forehead.

dialogue: Tu sabes que el te quiere mucho... That’s why he’s tough on you, you know that, right?
Mom, do you ever think about moving out of Brooklyn?
Our family doesn’t run from things, Miles.

content.text: Rio kisses his forehead. Gets up, LIGHTS OUT.

dialogue: He’s having a hard time, Jeff.
When it gets hard, that’s when he’s gotta stick it out.

content.text: Their voices fade.
Miles take the KEY out of his pocket in a closed fist as the MUFFLED SOUND of his parents’ voices fades away. Miles opens his hand, revealing the KEY. Miles stares at it.
SEQ. 1330 - PETER’S FUNERAL “PEF”
TV NEWS BULLETIN
Rio and Jefferson watch the news. Miles sits up in bed.

dialogue: We interrupt this broadcast for a special report. Sad news tonight. The hero known as Spider-Man has died after injuries related to another powerful earthquake in Brooklyn.

content.text: Over a montage of people around the city finding out Spider- Man died, we hear...

dialogue: Multiple sources are confirming that Peter Parker, a 26 year old grad student and part time photographer, operated as Spider- Man for at least a decade, saving by some counts thousands of lives around the world. With these tragic seismic events on the rise, one can only wonder, is there anyone who can keep New York safe?

content.text: People look at cell phones in Times Square.

dialogue: Peter Parker, Spider-Man, is dead. / He is survived by his wife Mary Jane and his aunt, May Parker. / Our hero Spider-Man is gone.

content.text: Miles stands in front of a TV display at a store window. All the TVS are playing the news about Spider-Man’s death. Miles looks at the TVs, his reflection appearing between photos of Spider-Man and Peter Parker.

dialogue: My husband Peter Parker was an ordinary person. He always said it could have been anyone behind the mask. He was just the kid who happened to get bit.

content.text: Miles looks at a Spider-Man costume, deciding. Then BUYS IT from a COMIC BOOK OWNER who looks A LOT LIKE...

dialogue: Can I return it if it doesn’t fit?

content.text: Beat. Stan head tilts to a sign: NO RETURNS. He smiles.
Miles puts the costume on and stares at himself in the mirror.

dialogue: He didn’t ask for his powers. But he chose to be Spider-Man.

content.text: He experiments, crouching in a classic Spider-Man pose. He relaxes then quickly tries another pose.
Miles walks in a sea of well wishers in full costume, many also in Spider-Man costumes, homemade and store bought.

dialogue: My favorite thing about Peter is that he made us each feel powerful. We all have powers of one kind or another. But in our own way, we are all Spider-man. And we’re all counting on you.
Probably not you specifically. I think it’s a metaphor.

content.text: MJ backs away from the dais. Aunt May comforts her.
Miles rounds a corner and takes out the Spider-Man Origins comic book. He flips to a page that depicts Peter testing his new powers by jumping from a building.
Miles RUNS UP A FLIGHT OF STAIRS, eyes determined. He BURSTS THROUGH A DOOR AND onto--
Miles walks to the edge, looks DOWN and then ACROSS to the neighboring roof, calculating the jump.
He BACKS UP. Cracks his neck. Waits there. As the MUSIC CRESCENDOES--
Miles RUNS DOWN A FLIGHT OF STAIRS.
Miles, disappointed in himself for chickening out, eyes a SHORTER BUILDING.
Miles RUNS UP ANOTHER FLIGHT OF STAIRS.
He BACKS UP. Cracks his neck...then RUNS, gaining speed--
--and TRIPS on his untied shoelace, FALLING TO THE GROUND BELOW. We make a meal of the fall, comics-style.
Miles lands with a CRACK (BURST CARD), and pulls out the key which is now TOTALLY BROKEN.
SEQ. 1400 - THE CEMETERY “CEM” - PART 1
It's snowing now. Empty and quiet. Footsteps on snow as Miles approaches Peter Parker's grave.
He takes off his mask, looks down at Parker's gravestone and sighs, then speaks, so softly we can barely hear him.

dialogue: I’m sorry, Mr. Parker... That thing you gave me, that key...
I think I really messed it up. I want to do what you asked. I really do, but... I’m sorry. I’m not sure I’m the guy. I can’t do this without you.

content.text: BEHIND MILES a DARK FIGURE rises, casting a shadow.
Terrified, Miles pulls his mask down and TURNS AROUND--
--The figure steps forward -- Miles panics and throws his arms up, accidentally delivering a VENOM STRIKE.
The Dark Figure flies back as WEBBING flies from his hands and sticks to Miles, yanking Miles forward.
Miles sits up and looks at his HANDS, the webbing.

dialogue: What did I do to him? Uh...

content.text: Miles runs over to the body, pulls back his jacket and reveals a SPIDER-MAN COSTUME.
SEQ. 2090 - PETER’S FLASHBACK “PFB”

dialogue: Alright people, let’s do this one last time. My name is Peter B. Parker...

content.text: PAGES FLIP FAST: "Coming next month! A Spider-Man from another world..."
SPLASH PAGE: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN
QUICK FLASHES, similar but not identical to the ones we saw in the cold open. High-energy running, fighting, leaping...

dialogue: ...I was bitten by a radioactive spider. And for the last twenty-two years I thought I was the one and only "Spider-Man".

content.text: Peter on a gargoyle drinking coffee with the morning paper.

dialogue: I’m pretty sure you know the rest.

scene_info.location: A rapid barrage of IMAGES from Spider-Man canon whiz by -- but with VARIATIONS and NEW SHOTS too. Instead of Uncle Ben on the bed, for instance, it’s AUNT MAY.

dialogue: You see I saved the city, fell in love, I got married, saved the city some more, maybe too much, my marriage got testy, made some dicey money choices -- don’t invest in a Spider-themed restaurant...

content.text: We see a few FAST IMAGES of Spider-Man doing his thing but losing a step, swinging with coffee, etc.,standing in front of a shuttered TGISpideys, signing divorce papers, HOLDING HIS BACK, BAD INVESTMENTS, DOOR SLAMMING, GETTING HIT BY A DRONE.

dialogue: ...Then like fifteen years passed blah blah blah super boring, I broke my back, a drone flew into my face, I buried Aunt May, my wife and I split up.

scene_info.location: A rapid barrage of IMAGES from Spider-Man canon whiz by -- but with VARIATIONS and NEW SHOTS too. Instead of Uncle Ben on the bed, for instance, it’s AUNT MAY.

dialogue: But I handled it like a champion.

content.text: CUT TO Peter CRYING on the floor of the shower in his spider- suit.

dialogue: ‘Cause you know what? No matter how many times I get hit, I always get back up.

content.text: Peter’s slumped like a slug in bed, wearing his costume. His ALARM goes off -- he lifts up his mask and immediately pulls it back down. He refuses to shut off the alarm, so it keeps BLARING.
He watches TV. A nature show. Seahorses reflecting in his SAD SPIDER EYES.

dialogue: And I got a lot of time to reflect and work on myself. Did you know that seahorses that they mate for life? Could you imagine a seahorse seeing another seahorse and then making it work?
She wanted kids and it scared me.

content.text: Peter sits on the roof of a building looking at his phone, deciding whether or not to call MJ.

dialogue: I’m pretty sure I broke her heart.
Flash forward, I’m in my apartment doing pushups, doing ab crunches, getting strong--

content.text: REVEAL PETER, with his costume half on, eating pizza--
--A TREMOR hits the room causing the same strange “color separation” we saw before. Peter’s whole body suddenly SHAKES AND VIBRATES as he LOOKS UP--
--Where A PSYCHEDELIC PORTAL YAWNS OPEN, sucking him TOWARD IT -- his body FLIES UP, halftones more prominent--

scene_info.location: A rapid barrage of IMAGES from Spider-Man canon whiz by -- but with VARIATIONS and NEW SHOTS too. Instead of Uncle Ben on the bed, for instance, it’s AUNT MAY.

dialogue: ... And I gotta say, weird things happen to me a lot. But this was real weird.

content.text: Peter uses his limbs to fight but it's TOO STRONG... the portal CLOSES. The pizza slice drops on the floor.
Halftone Peter flies SCREAMING through an INSANE MULTIVERSE, trying to PULL HIS MASK ON...
...he is falling towards a STRANGE KALEIDOSCOPE OF SPIDER- MEN, just like we saw earlier, towards the BRIGHT CENTER...
Peter EXPLODES IN AN ENERGY BURST OUT OF THE COLLIDER (the pulse from earlier that spread through Brooklyn after Spider- Man and Green Goblin fell into the beam).
Peter TUMBLES and CAREENS through a BLUR OF CITY and NIGHT SKY as his MOLECULES SOLIDIFY, finally coming to rest in--
TIMES SQUARE
Peter slowly stands, stares open-mouthed at STRANGE BUILDINGS, BILLBOARDS and STORES with close-but-not-quite- right LOGOS.

dialogue: ...You see I was in New York, but... things were different.

content.text: Finally Peter looks at a ticker-tape LED sign in front of NNN (National News Network-- a cable station): "NEW YORK’S HERO, SPIDER-MAN, FOUND DEAD AT 26"

dialogue: Also I was dead. And blonde. I was kind of... perfect. It was like looking in a mirror.

content.text: We cut from RIPeter to this new Peter, LIFTING HIS MASK. One slick and new, one old and BEAT UP.
CUT TO Peter at Spider-Man’s funeral. MJ gives her eulogy.

dialogue: My husband Peter Parker was an ordinary person.
He always said it could have been anyone behind the mask.
I have a feeling the thing that brought me here, was the thing that got him killed. You wanna know what happened next?

content.text: We see Miles "venom strike" again.
SEQ. 1400 - THE CEMETERY “CEM” - PART 2
Miles approaches the figure. A flash of spidey-sense. The figure looks like Peter Parker, but with BROWN HAIR.

dialogue: What are you doing over there? Freeze! PDNY!

content.text: A flashlight finds Miles who STARTLES, hands up.
--Miles decides to RUN! But he's tied to an unconscious body, and is SNAPPED BACK--

dialogue: Are you kidding me right now?

content.text: Police approach, TURNING ON BODY CAMERAS. Miles gasps. Frantic, HE PICKS UP the immobile "Peter" ON HIS BACK--
Miles PICKS UP SURPRISING SPEED, tracking FOOTPRINTS in the snow which Peter's dragging legs quickly blur.
Miles sees THE GLINT of the web shooters on Peter's wrist. THINKING FAST, he aims Peter's arm to shoot webbing.
The webs dart out and attach to a nearby tree. Miles and Peter swing forward--
--then they CREST, and go SAILING BACK--
They SPIN THROUGH THE AIR then SMACK ONTO A WALL, Peter DRAGGING Miles down--
--Peter lands in the snow and Miles lands in his lap.

dialogue: C’mon now! Put em' up, son!

content.text: Miles puts his and Peter's hands up. Flops the hands around as he gesticulates--
--Miles accidentally uses Peter’s web shooter, firing it toward an oncoming elevated train... it CONNECTS!
--WHOOSH!  Miles and Peter are WHIPPED OUT OF FRAME and DRAGGED away through the snow by the TRAIN.
BAM! He slams into the PETER PARKER GRAVESTONE, knocked out as Miles PINBALLS from gravestone to gravestone--
SEQ. 1450 - THE SPIDER-MEN “TSM”
Miles and an unconscious Peter get dragged through the city. The train lifts them up into the air, above the traffic as COP CARS FOLLOW BEHIND, SIRENS BLAZING.
PETERS LIPS FLAP.
The trajectory of the train lowers them down towards an unsuspecting BICYCLIST. Miles and Peter get tangled with the bicyclist, causing him to go flying in the air (MULTIPANEL).
They whiz through ONCOMING TRAFFIC, pedestrians, Miles trying to swing his weight around to maneuver through.
Trying to lift up Peter, Miles instead forces his face INTO THE GROUND. Peter is knocked unconscious again.
Miles realizes he has to HANDLE THIS SOMEHOW--
--Miles PUPPETS PETER’S BODY, moving Peter's legs and arms to parkour over cars, push off signs, anything to survive.
Two COPS sit in traffic - their radio CRACKLES TO LIFE.

dialogue: ...Looks like a child dressed as Spider-Man dragging a homeless corpse behind a train--

content.text: The guys hit the SIREN LIGHTS--
--Peter comes to again, so groggy..

dialogue: Why are you trying to kill me?--
--I’m not! I’m trying to save you!

content.text: --BAM! Peter's head HITS a TRAFFIC LIGHT and he is KNOCKED UNCONSCIOUS AGAIN--
Peter comes to again as they stuck to the side of a bus and slowly sliiiiiide along the window. The train keeps moving, the web is STRETCHING TAUT... Peter comes to again, so groggy...
Finally, the train stops at a station and they COME TO A STOP at an intersection. Miles and Peter DETACH onto a sidewalk surrounded by NEW YORKERS who simply WALK OVER THEM.

dialogue: Hey, uh, maybe you guys can go around? Alright. Thanks, New York.

content.text: SEQ. 2100 - GETTING ANSWERS, BOOM! “GAB”
TIME CUT:
PETER'S POV -- he opens his eyes.

dialogue: What was that? Kid electrocuted me... with his hands?

content.text: Peter, so GROGGY, is tied to a punching bag. The punching bag is tied with many many many many ropes. And computer cords. Like a homemade spiderweb. Miles sits opposite him.
A FLASH OF SPIDER-SENSE. Peter realizes what Miles is.
Miles puts up a tough front. He nearly pulls it off...
Peter LUNGES erratically. Miles startles, frightened--

dialogue: Why do you look like Peter Parker?
Then why aren’t you dead? Why is your hair different? Why are you older, why is your body... a different shape?
Pretty sure you just called me fat.
--Hey listen, you don't look so hot either kid. Most superheroes don't wear their own merch.

content.text: Miles looks at his outfit and frowns. Why is this dude throwing shade at him?

dialogue: Like a parallel universe where things are like this universe but different? And you're Spider-Man in that universe? But somehow traveled to this universe, but you don’t know how?
Wow. That was really just a guess?
Well, we learned about it in physics.
This is amazing. You can teach me just like Peter said he would--
Look I made a promise to him.
Here’s lesson number one, kid. Don't watch the mouth. Watch the hands.

content.text: Peter holds up his UNTIED hands. Miles is flabbergasted. Peter stands up.
Before Miles can react, Peter leaps, kicks-spins the punching bag toward Miles, knocking him over HARD!
--Peter WEBS HIS MOUTH SHUT.
Peter BOUNDS to the window. Turns back... feeling guilty.

dialogue: Trust me, kid, this'll all make you a better Spider-Man.

content.text: Peter LEAPS FROM THE WINDOW--
--but his powers GLITCH, he FALLS. We hear him SCREAM, then hit the fire escape.
SEQ. 1750 - TEAMING UP “TEU”

dialogue: What’s going on with your body?
I don’t think my atoms are real jazzed about being in the wrong dimension.
Look, I’m not looking for a side gig as a Spider-Man coach. I got a lot going on in my dimension, like a lot.
Don’t you dare finish that sentence- - don’t do it. I’m sick of it.
Want my advice? Go back to being a regular kid--
I don’t have a choice. Kingpin’s got a supercollider. He’s trying to kill me.
Wait a second, what did you just say?
Who cares about that? Where’s the collider?

content.text: Peter starts WALKING DOWN THE BUILDING. Miles sttuggles to FOLLOW. (Note: rest of scene staged like a classic NYC movie “walk and talk” but IT’S VERTICAL...and one of the participants HASN’T LEARNED TO WALK YET)

dialogue: When it runs again, I’ll just jump in and get back to my life--
--You can’t let them run it. I’m supposed to destroy it so it never runs again or everyone’s gonna die--
--Or everyone’s going to die. That is what they always say.
But there’s always a little bit of time before everybody dies, and that’s when I do my best work.
Aren’t you going to need this?

content.text: Miles produces the goober.

dialogue: Ah you have a goober. Give it.

content.text: Peter reaches out. Miles holds it back.

dialogue: Wait, no. Not so fast. He called it an override key.
There’s always a bypass key, a virus key, a who-cares key I can never remember so I just call it a goober. Give it.
I need it to destroy the collider.
I need it to go home!

content.text: Miles puts it in his mouth.

dialogue: No! I’ll swallow it, don’t play with me!

content.text: Peter starts to walk again, knowing he’ll provoke a response.
Without even looking at Miles, Peter nonchalantly webs the goober right out of Miles mouth.

dialogue: The collider created a portal that brought me here. And I have to g--
No, it... broke. I don’t remember what happened.
This is why I never had kids, this is why I never did that.
No, we can’t do anything. Thanks to you I have to re-steal what your guy stole from Alchemax and make another one of these.

Look, if I don’t turn off the collider after you leave, everyone in this city, my parents, my uncle, and millions of others will die, and you’re just gonna go home and leave me here to figure this out for myself? You good with that, Spider-Man?

content.text: Peter walks away over the top of the building and disappears from sight.
Miles, utterly defeated sits down on the wall. With his head in his hands.
Peter peeks his head back over the ledge. Not so far below the surface is the guy who used to care, but...

dialogue: Making you feel guilty. Is it working?
How could it, no-- Look at me, does it look like it’s working? No it’s.. no it’s... ohhhh...
Ahhh!!! No! No! Do not let him win!

content.text: Miles raises his head up to see Peter walk back towards him.

dialogue: C’mon, we don’t have a second to lose.

content.text: Miles smiles.
SEQ. 2120 - GREEK DINER “GRK”
--MATCH CUT Miles’ face, annoyed.
Peter STUFFS HIS FACE while Miles watches. This is not a normal Spider-Man.

dialogue: I love this burger. So delicious. One of the best burgers I’ve ever had. In my universe, this place closed six years ago. I don’t know why. I really don’t.
You have money right? I’m not very liquid right now.
You gonna eat that? I’m listening.
The other Peter said he was going to be showing me the ropes.
You got any Spider-Man tips you can tell me now?
Yeah I got plenty. Disinfect the mask. You’re gonna want to use baby powder in the suit, heavy on the joints. You don’t want any chafing, right?
I think you’re going to be a bad teacher.
Mhmm.. Look up where Alchemax is.
A private technological campus in Hudson Valley, New York.
You can teach me to swing on the way there.

content.text: Peter LAUGHS.
SEQ. 2140 - HITCHING A RIDE “HAR”
TIME CUT -- Peter and Miles ride a bus through the Hudson Valley.

dialogue: I’m not swinging to the Hudson Valley, Miles. Not after a hearty burger-breakfast. Keep your legs fresh, you’re gonna thank me later.

content.text: As Miles shakes his head we CUT TO:
SEQ. 2300 - USE THE GOOD FEAR “UGF”
UNZIP! SHORTS DOWN! MASKS ON! THEY SUIT UP! Reveal Miles wearing a YELLOW CAPE with his Spidey-suit.

dialogue: And it’s a no on the cape.

content.text: Peter grabs the cape. Miles grabs it. A bit of a tug of war.

dialogue: Take that off, it’s disrespectful. Spider-Man doesn’t wear a cape.

content.text: Finally Peter yanks the cape from Miles.
Miles and Peter lie at the edge of the woods SCOPING IT OUT. Beautiful Zaha Hadid style buildings, a dream campus. Peppered amongst are THUGGISH GUYS in lab coats.

dialogue: So how do we retrace Peter’s steps?
That’s a good question... What would I do if I were me...?
Got it. Step One: I infiltrate the lab...

content.text: We QUICKLY see MULTI-PANEL IMAGES of the mission going off without a hitch -- and with Miles barely appearing.

dialogue: Two: Find the head scientist's computer--

content.text: MILES INTERRUPTS HIS IMAGE OF A CLASSIC SCIENTIST.

dialogue: That lady with the bike is the head scientist. I saw her in this documentary at school.
Cool. Step Three: I re-examine my personal biases. Step Four: I hack the computer--

content.text: --Miles POPS into the multi-panel image of Peter downloading the override code from the scientist’s computer--

dialogue: --Not now hold on, I just lost my train of thought... Step Five: download the important stuff, I’ll know it when I see it, and Step Six:... I grab a bagel from the cafeteria and run.

content.text: BACK LIVE

dialogue: --uh Step 7: You stay here, you’re lookout. Very important.

content.text: Miles reacts.

dialogue: Look, man you have to teach me to do Spider-Man stuff or I’m not going to be able to help--
Watch and learn, kid, I’ll quiz you later!

content.text: --Then he’s gone, stealthily swinging across the clearing toward the ALCHEMAX BUILDING, where Peter crawls down to a GRATE, opens it, and ENTERS. Now Miles is ALONE IN THE WOODS.

dialogue: Why did I get stuck with the janky- old, broke, hobo Spider-Man?

content.text: Miles PUNCHES the rock and cracks it.
Suddenly a LIMO PULLS UP TO THE BUILDING, and who should step out but KINGPIN, flanked by Tombstone, he walks into Alchemax. Miles FREEZES.
He hides behind the rock, thinking. What does he do? What does he do? What does he do?
--HARD CUT to Miles running across a field towards Alchemax.

dialogue: What am I doing? What am I doing? What am I doing? What am I doing?

content.text: Miles looks over the side of the building, as KINGPIN and TOMBSTONE enter.
He AWKWARDLY ENTERS THE OPEN GRATE into--
SEQ. 2350 - IN THE VENTS “ITV”
Miles crawls through. He follows Kingpin, with Tombstone, marching through the halls below. Kingpin blocks light from below as he walks.
Miles isn’t looking where he’s going, so he fails to notice the LARGE BUTT ahead, CRASHING INTO IT--

dialogue: Yeah, what are you doing here?!

content.text: --Miles tries to worm up next to Peter. Miles and Peter complain like two brothers sharing a sleeping bag.

dialogue: C’mon! You’re stepping on my foot!
Move a little to your right--
No, I can’t sit there and just let Spider-Man die without doing anything about it. I’m not doing that again.

content.text: Peter reacts. Softens.

dialogue: Most people I meet in the workplace try to kill me, so, you’re a nice change of pace.

content.text: BELOW THE VENTS, the Head Scientist leads Kingpin to a computer--

dialogue: --Look at this data. I know you can’t really understand it, but these are really good numbers--

content.text: She goes to the computer and enters her password.

dialogue: (shows photos of cluster poles and busses, etc.)
Uh Mr. Fiske. If we fire again this week, there could be a black hole under Brooklyn. You see this? And this? This is multiple dimensions beginning to crash into each other.

content.text: VENTS: Miles and Peter listen. Miles growing very nervous Peter noticing.

dialogue: --This is pretty standard Spider- Man stakes, you get used to it. Watch this, he’s going to say ‘you’ve got 24 hours!’
What this means is that there could be a rupture in the space time continuum.
Oooh, that’s bad. Actually everything she said was bad, I was lying before.

content.text: --The group below is EXITING. As they do Peter SPRINGS INTO ACTION--
--Peter climbs out of the air vent and smoothly crawls upside down along a ceiling duct and jumps down. He starts hacking into the scientist’s computer. He hears her off-screen talking to Fisk.

dialogue: OK hold on, let me show you some more data--

content.text: Peter looks back, sees Miles out of the vent.
Miles exerts himself, trying to unstick. He shakes his head.

dialogue: OK, relax your fingers! We don’t have time. Just “let go,” be in the moment!
--I am in the moment, it’s a terrible moment!--

content.text: CUT OUTSIDE TO Kingpin and the Head Scientist.
CUT BACK INSIDE TO MILES.

dialogue: They’re right there, they’re going to see you! Miles, you gotta unstick. What do you do to relax?

content.text: Beat. Miles begins to sing his song from the opening.
Miles starts humming to himself. He unsticks a finger. Then another. Starts to move his hands.
--The rest of MILES’ fingers come unstuck and Miles starts to FALL. Miles and the metal duct CRASH TO THE GROUND with a huge CLANG!
SEQ. 2400 - ALCHEMAX LABS “ACL”
Peter’s spider-sense motivates him to look at the door’s window, through which he sees the Head Scientist TURN BACK TO HER OFFICE, having heard the crash.
He’s nowhere to be seen. But we can hear him. They continue to WHISPER-YELL.

dialogue: I’m right in front of you. Can Spider-Man turn invisible?
Ow! You just poked me in my eye!
This is incredible-- some kind of fight or flight thing.

content.text: The Head Scientist WALKS TOWARD HER OFFICE to INVESTIGATE-- Peter turns, suddenly in a PANIC--

dialogue: Slow down, Peter! I-- I need to write it down!

content.text: The Head Scientist walks into her office to see Spider-Man STANDING “CASUALLY” with his arm on her desk and a METAL DUCT dented in the MIDDLE OF THE FLOOR.

dialogue: Oh, hey. Didn't see you there...
Wow. Okay I’m kinda freaking out right now. I mean, you're supposed to be dead.

content.text: The Head Scientist suddenly pulls up Spidey's mask--

dialogue: Whoa!--OK that's a no-no, we don’t like that--

content.text: --revealing Peter's face.
ON THE HEAD SCIENTIST, she GASPS. She quickly appraises him up and down, now LASER FOCUSSED--.
She snaps on a latex glove and grabs Peter’s face.
The Head Scientist BENDS DOWN to poke Peter’s STOMACH. Behind her we see semi-visible Miles running around, confused. Peter’s eyes WIDEN -- he’s gonna be caught!

dialogue: OK, a little bit of a gut, perhaps from dimensional warping.
Oh yeah, yeah, yeah. I was way flatter before I warped.

content.text: Miles ARRIVES AT THE COMPUTER and frantically plugs in his DRIVE, typing the password: Dgfampesand#4$...then...??

dialogue: Travel through the multiverse appears to have deteriorated...

content.text: ON MILES/THE SCREEN:
Miles pauses, unsure of the rest. Peter WHISTLES.
The Head Scientist LOOKS UP AT PETER IN RESPONSE, a little SUSPICIOUS--

dialogue: --How old are you? You don’t look a day over 35!

content.text: Miles types the 35. It WORKS! But then a BAFFLING DESKTOP FULL OF FILES appears.
As Peter FRANTICALLY CLOCKS MILES while trying to not be obvious -- The scientist shoves Peter into a chair, hard--
--Mechanical RESTRAINTS strap Peter to the chair.
She grabs a TOOL. Advances.

dialogue: I know, I just need to get these samples.

content.text: She jams a tongue depressor in Peter’s mouth.
The Head Scientist studies a sample on a slide.

dialogue: Wow. Just complete cellular decay. I’ve never seen anything like this.

content.text: Peter sees a MONITOR AND COMPUTER FLOATING IN THE AIR.

dialogue: I’m just taking the whole thing!

content.text: The Head Scientist turns to look at Peter.

dialogue: Glitching? No. Why would you even say that?
If you stay in this dimension too long, your body’s going to disintegrate. Do you know how painful that would be, Peter Parker?
And I, for one, can’t wait to watch.
What did you say your name was?

content.text: OH NO. She takes off her blue glasses and puts on red goggles. Her TENTACLES UNFURL. One TENTACLE grabs Peter by the neck and slams him into the wall. Ladies and gentlemen, meet this dimensions DOCTOR OCTOPUS.

dialogue: Can I assume that your friends call you Doc Ock?
My friends actually call me Liv.
My enemies call me Doc Ock.

content.text: Peter shoots a web towards the door control panel, opening the door for Miles to escape through.
Miles looks down the empty hallway but hesitates leaving Peter behind.
Miles takes off down the hallway. Peter is repeatedly SLAMMED into the glass walls as Miles runs by him--

dialogue: --I got it handled buddy! Everything is fine!

content.text: The ALARM BLARES, with RED ALERT LIGHTING--

MILES runs, terrified, carrying the computer. Flashing between visible and invisible like a human strobe light. So many emotions swirling his powers can’t tap into just one--He RUNS INTO A LAB ASSISTANT, turning VISIBLE--

dialogue: Okay this is a little bit bad.

content.text: The Lab Assistant leaps up, freaked -- she sure looks like GWANDA IN A LAB COAT...
Peter and Doc Ock continue fighting through offices and laboratories. It’s, well, let’s let Peter tell us:

dialogue: --And this is the moment that I’m losing the fight.

content.text: --BOOM! PETER SMASHES through the WALL and lands next to Miles. Peter WINCES IN PAIN.
Miles holds up the computer and monitor, shrugs.

dialogue: Alright, let me tell you the good news. We don’t need the monitor.

content.text: Peter grabs the monitor, throws it----Peter is already SWINGING OUT THE DOOR. Miles is SHOCKED--
--Then, THROUGH THE DUST we see the ICONIC 4 METALLIC ARMED SILHOUETTE of DOC OCK! She EMERGES, towering above.

dialogue: Peter! You didn’t tell me you had an invisible friend! Could you give me that back, young man?

content.text: Her ARM extends to Miles when Peter swings Miles out the door.
Peter YANKS HIM THROUGH THE DOOR, shooting ANOTHER WEB to CLOSE THE DOOR in OCK’S FACE! Nice going, Peter!
SEQ. 2500 - ESCAPE HUDSON VALLEY “EHV”
Miles and Peter run out of a door and find themselves facing a group of dining SECURITY GUARD GRAD STUDENTS. A beat.

dialogue: Wow. This’d be a good time to turn invisible.
Ok, not going to turn invisible.
Selecting a bagel... act super normal...

content.text: Peter starts to walk past the Buffet SUPER NORMAL (not normal at all), helps himself to a bagel...
...as he walks. Miles follows. The Security Guard Students notice--

dialogue: You know it’s funny I get that a lot.

content.text: Peter trades Miles the bagel for the computer.
--The students PULL OUT WEAPONRY. Peter GRABS THE COMPUTER. As Peter and Miles RUN, the students CHASE!

dialogue: Get back here! Where do you think you’re going? He took a bagel!

content.text: AS THEY RUN -- Peter takes off one of his WEB-SHOOTERS, throws it to Miles, who struggles to put it on:

dialogue: Alright time to swing, just like I taught you!
When did you teach me that?
I didn’t! It’s a little joke for team building!

content.text: Peter passes a web-shooter THROWS MILES OFF THE DECK, swinging into the forest.
Peter SWINGS INTO THE TREES, but Miles is FROZEN. He’s never actually swung before!
Miles is a disaster -- TWISTING and FLAILING on his web as GUNFIRE explodes branches and tree trunks around him.

dialogue: Whoa, whoa, I can’t do this yet!
Everybody knows that the best way to learn is under intense, life- threatening pressure!

content.text: Miles fumbles with his web shooter.
But he MISSES, TUMBLING to the ground! Guards find him and start SHOOTING.
Miles SPRINTS along the forest floor as Peter swings above him.

dialogue: What are you doing down there?!
I run better than I swing!
You gotta swing or they’ll catch you! This is what you wanted!

content.text: Miles hears a BUZZSAW. Doc Ock appears CUTTING DOWN TREES with her mechanical arms.
Miles tries to find purchase with his web shooter but he keeps missing.
Peter doubles back, yelling advice back at Miles.

dialogue: Aim with your hips. Look where you want it to hit. Square your shoulders.
Don’t forget to follow through. Don’t shoot off your back foot.

content.text: Miles runs up a tree -- he’s out of runway!

dialogue: That’s the best idea you’ve had all day!

content.text: Miles leaps off the tree, shoots off a web and.. It CONNECTS! He swings away as Peter knocks down Doc Ock.
Miles swings onto a branch and swings alongside Peter.

dialogue: Good, you’re doing it! Double tap to release and thwip it out again. Thwip and--

content.text: --We’re actually SEEING THE “THWIPS” ONSCREEN--
It’s ugly...but they look pretty good. They really do.

dialogue: I gotta say, you’re amazing man!
We’re a little team. Me as the teacher who can still do it. You as the student who can do it just not as good. I’m proud of us! Is there something you want to say to me?

content.text: Just then, Peter GLITCHES, falling down onto a thick branch.
Miles crashes onto the branch, grabbing the computer by it’s power cord. However, the BRANCH BREAKS, causing both to fall down, which allows Ock to grab the computer -- They're done for. But then--
--WHOOSH! -- A BLACK and PINK BLUR swings by.
In mid-air we see a mysterious girl in a HOODIE and BALLET SHOES dispatches Doc Ock while WEBBING Peter and Miles to safety.
She lands, with Miles and Peter in embarrassing positions. She DE-MASKS.

dialogue: Oh, you know her? Very cool.
I'm from another dimension. I mean, another, another dimension.

content.text: SEQ. 2545 - GWEN’S FLASHBACK “GFB”
COMIC BOOK PANELS FLIP TO REVEAL:
SPIDER-GWEN #65: TEAM UP WITH ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN!

dialogue: Alright people. Let’s start at the beginning one last time. My name is Gwen Stacy.

content.text: We intercut Spider-Gwen (aka-Gwanda) battling THE LIZARD (vaguely resembles Peter Parker) in a slightly different location than the earlier Green Goblin fight, but with identical shot language.

dialogue: I was bitten by a radioactive spider. And for the last two years I've been the one and only Spider- Woman.

content.text: QUICK FLASHES of 1) Gwen banging on a drum set, 2) Gwen’s Dad in a COP UNIFORM being SAVED by Spider-Gwen, 3) Spider-Gwen dealing the death blow to the Lizard Monster only for him to turn into PETER PARKER as he dies, Gwen, devastated 4) Gwen WALKING DOWN THE STREET, ALL ALONE, hands in pockets, and 5) Spider-Gwen fighting Doc Ock in a different COLLIDER ROOM--

dialogue: I joined a band. Saved my dad. I couldn’t save my best friend, Peter Parker. So now I save everyone else. And I don’t do friends anymore. Just to avoid any distractions. And one day this weird thing happened.

content.text: Gwen wins the fight. Yes! But then a PORTAL opens above her and she's SUCKED IN, her particles becoming HALFTONE -
Gwen EXPLODES IN AN ENERGY BURST OUT OF THE COLLIDER.

dialogue: I was blown into last week. Literally. I landed in New York. But not my New York.

content.text: Gwen TUMBLES and CAREENS through a BLUR OF CITY and NIGHT SKY as her MOLECULES SOLIDIFY, TIMELAPSE SHOWING HER TRAVELING “BACK IN TIME”, then finally coming to rest in -

TIMES SQUARE... Gwen slowly stands. Stares at the same Cocoa Kola billboard where Peter found himself earlier. She sees FOOTAGE in Times Square of Spider-Man rescuing people from earthquakes - the same clip we saw earlier in Jefferson’s car.

dialogue: ...this is the second earthquake in the Tri-State area this month. Lucky for these folks, Spider-Man was there to save the day!

content.text: Gwen gets SPIDER-SENSE, sees Miles, then gets stuck to him.

dialogue: My Spider-sense told me to head to Visions Academy. I wasn’t sure why until I met you--
You don’t get to like my haircut.

content.text: The sound of GUNSHOTS RINGS through the forest. The GRAD STUDENTS are coming.
Gwen fires her shooter and swings away.
Peter swings away. Miles fumbles with web-shooters...

dialogue: How many more spider people are there?

content.text: --As BULLETS HIT, Miles is WEBBED AND PULLED OUT OF FRAME.
SEQ. 2550 - SUPER-VILLAINS GETTING ANGRY “SGA”
Kingpin sits on the sun deck, slowly and purposefully CLICKING a ballpoint pen. His stare is hard and intense, but unfocused.
FLASHBACK:
CUT TO A PORTRAIT of Kingpin with his WIFE and SON hangs on an office wall. It’s KNOCKED DOWN when Spider-Man is THROWN into frame, against the wall. Kingpin is FIGHTING Spider-Man, it’s BRUTAL.

VANESSA, Kingpin’s wife in the portrait, walks in with their 13 year old son, RICHARD just as KINGPIN is about to deliver the death blow to Spider-Man. They can’t believe the level of violence they’re seeing.
Kingpin TURNS AROUND with BLOOD SPLATTER on his face. He realizes what they’ve seen.
Vanessa takes Richard’s hand and FLEES.
She gets into her car and PEELS OUT. Richard turns around in his seat and looks back at Kingpin as they DRIVE AWAY.

dialogue: Don’t look back honey. It’s okay. It’s okay.

content.text: Richard LOCKS EYES with a devastated Kingpin. Vanessa flies through a stop sign. Her car is T-boned.
PRESENT DAY: Kingpin BREAKS the pen in half.
Ock swings in, disheveled. Kingpin leans in with MURDEROUS EYES. Ock REACTS, WEAPONS DRAWN. A STANDOFF.

dialogue: I killed Spider-Man. Why did I just see two more?
There’s three actually. No this is good, this is very, very good. It means you get what you want. It means my collider works.
All we have to do is kill a couple spiders...and the collider will bring your family back...As many families as you want.

content.text: A tense beat, all wait for Kingpin’s response. He imperceptibly nods to Tombstone, who holsters his guns. They turn and walk out.
SEQ. 2700 - THERE ARE OTHERS “TAO”

A BUS. INSIDE, Miles and Gwen sit next to each other. Gwen holds the broken goober in her hand. Both want to talk, neither wants to start the conversation. It should feel kind of like them side-by-side in class.
Peter SNORES in the back seat.

dialogue: Yeah. He’s actually really embarrassed about it. So, just keep it between us, ok?
I know where we can make a new one. And we won’t let him break it this time.

content.text: Gwen and Miles smile at each other. She’s letting Miles off the hook.

dialogue: I know how hard this is, to have to figure this stuff out on your own. It’s kinda nice not being the only Spider person around.
Yeah. If you ever decide to do friends again, I could always open up a slot.

content.text: A beat. Gwen considers.
Miles smiles at Gwen. In the back seat, we see Peter is awake and listening.
Peter takes in A SMALL HOUSE. There are CARDS, BOUQUETS, and TOYS cluttering the porch. A TEXT BOX onscreen tells us: SOMEWHERE IN QUEENS

dialogue: Peter, we’re literally on the doorstep.
Bad idea, bad idea, this is a bad idea--

content.text: The front door opens a crack, AUNT MAY’S eyes peering out.

dialogue: You guys are all very sweet but no more fans today, please.

content.text: AUNT MAY’s eyes WIDEN.  She steps out onto her porch, stunned at the sight of Peter. Isn’t he supposed to be dead? And for Peter, isn’t Aunt May dead?

dialogue: Hey Aunt May... So this is going to sound crazy... but I’m pretty sure that I’m from an--

content.text: May touches his face in awe. Peter absorbs her touch.

dialogue: I was there... when it all happened. I am so sorry.
And what dimension are you from?
Did Peter have a place where we could make another one of these?

content.text: Miles shows her the busted doodad. Aunt May regards it...
BACK YARD
Aunt May KICKS OPEN A DOOR and leads them to a GARDEN SHED in the tidy yard.

dialogue: Oh yeah, I got one of these too. A little shed where I keep my spider- gear--

content.text: --A SPIDER-GRAPHIC begins to glow on the shed's door, which opens to reveal an ELEVATOR. Aunt May looks at Peter: was YOURS like this?  As they enter:

dialogue: I mean, this place is pretentious.

content.text: --into RIPeter's MASSIVE, SPIDER-MAN MEETS CALATRAVA LAB: Crammed with crime-fighting and science gear, photos, hangout furniture, not to mention every Spider-branded product in existence.
They reach the bottom, fan out, exploring.

dialogue: Whoa. Dude, was yours anything like this?
Mine was like this, but take away the jeep, the plane... imagine it way smaller. Imagine a futon. I feel sad for this guy.

content.text: Miles notices one of 616Peter’s costumes... it has a CAPE. He looks back at Peter slyly, vindicated.
Peter finds a PHOTO: RIPeter and MJ, together. Happy. It hits him hard. Miles notices.

dialogue: Hey Peter, I think this is a cape.

content.text: Peter can't help smiling. Gwen, in turn, watches this happen, her wheels turning.
Miles is looking at the costumes. His reflection, still a bit off-center. May walks up.

dialogue: Peter knew how dangerous the job was. But he figured the only one who could stop this guy was Spider- Man.
Kingpin knows we’re coming. We’re going to be outnumbered.

content.text: May holds out “my name is” stickers.
MILES’ POV: Four sets of eyes open in the shadows. Spider sense rings out EVERYWHERE. Miles GASPS. Gwen SPINS AROUND, on high alert.
On a SHOCKED Peter, Miles, and Gwen.

dialogue: You think you’re the only people who thought to come here?

content.text: SOUND OF BLINDS FLICKING OPEN-- SPIDER-MAN NOIR is lit with venetian blind shadows, a black-and-white figure whose coat is inexplicably billowing around him.

dialogue: Is he in black and white?
Where is that wind coming from? We’re in a basement.
Wherever I go, the wind follows. And the wind, smells like rain.

content.text: SOUND OF MACHINE WHIRRING ABOVE. BOOM! PENI PARKER JUMPS DOWN from above.
BOOM! SP//dr, Peni’s robot, LANDS BEHIND PENI IN A BADASS SPIDER-POSE.

dialogue: This could literally not get any weirder.

content.text: Spider-Ham walks into the shot next to Peter. Long beat. He sticks out his hand for Peter to shake.

dialogue: It CAN get weirder! I just washed my hands that’s why they’re wet. No other reason.

content.text: All of their spider senses go off.
SPIDER-HAM/ SPIDER-MAN NOIR/ PENI PARKER SP//DR comics drop on top of Gwen’s-- ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN CROSSOVER!
SPIDER-MAN NOIR/PENI/SPIDER- SPIDER-MAN NOIR/PENI HAM (STAGGERED) I was bitten by a radioactive My name is Peter Parker/My spider. name is Peni Parker/My name is Peter Porker.

dialogue: I was bitten by a radioactive pig.

content.text: Noir DISPATCHES ENDLESS BAD GUYS. A SPIDER in SP//dr’s helmet BITES Peni’s outstretched hand--

dialogue: In my universe it’s 1933 and I’m a private eye. I like to drink egg creams and I like to fight Nazis. A lot.
I am from New York in the year 3145. I have a psychic link with a spider who lives inside my father’s robot, and we’re best friends. Forever.
Sometimes I let matches burn down to my fingertips just to feel something, anything.

content.text: FULL SCREEN CRAZY SPIDER-HAM IMAGES: INCLUDING HIM WORKING AT THE DAILY BEAGLE WITH A NEWSROOM OF BEAGLES.

dialogue: I’m a photographer for the Daily Beagle. When I’m not pooching around, I’m working like a dog trying to sniff out the latest story. I frolic and I dance and I do this with my pants--

content.text: --BACK LIVE, as Peter interrupts--
Peter turns to Noir.

dialogue: So, uh, how did you get here?
Well, it’s kind of a long story.

content.text: THREE SECOND MONTAGE -- We see the collider explosion,but this time Noir, Peni, and Ham streak out of the explosion. They land in New York. MATCH CUT to them in the hideout.
SEQ. 2800 - A PUNCHER’S CHANCE “APC”

dialogue: And now we’re just trying to find a way home.
The only way home is back through the collider gizmo. The only trouble is--
--One of us has to stay behind and destroy it.
No, no, no, you don’t get it.

content.text: They all GLITCH. Real ugly.

dialogue: None of you can stay here. If you stay here, you’ll die. I’m the guy who’s going to turn it off and I’m going to get you all home before I do. Look, I made a promise. So I have to keep it.

content.text: They all look at Miles. It’s kind of inspiring, but--
Peter jumps in, immediatley in “music man” sales mode, talking Miles up.

dialogue: This is Miles, and he’s going to save the multiverse.
This kid can turn himself invisible! Watch this, he can do it... now!

content.text: Miles struggles to turn invisible but he can’t.

dialogue: I can’t do it on command--
--He can’t do it on command. But it is cool. Show them the zappy thing, Miles.

content.text: Once again, Miles tries to show off his power but he can’t do it.

dialogue: I can’t do it on command--
--He can’t do it on command. But he can do so much more, like what else do you do--
Look I’ve seen him in action. He’s got potential. I think he’s gonna get us home.

content.text: She says it with conviction. Everyone wants to believe it. Noir steps forward to prove it out.

dialogue: OK, little fella, Kingpin’s gonna send a lot of mugs after ya, I’m talking hard boys, real biscuit boxers. Can you fight them all off at once?
Well, I, I haven’t actually fought anyone--

content.text: Miles tries to fight Noir, but Noir knocks him down. Peni JUMPS IN.

dialogue: Can you re-wire a mainframe while being shot at?

content.text: Noir knocks him down again. FAST CUTS NOW --

dialogue: Can you swing and flip with the grace of a trained dancer?
Can you close off your feelings so you don’t get crippled by the moral ambiguity of your violent actions?
Can you help your aunt create an online dating profile so she can get out of the dang house once in a while?
Can you float through the air when you smell a delicious pie?
(makes sound effect of smashing his head)
Above all, no mater how many times you get hit, can you get back up?
Because when a Spider-Man is on the floor--
--When you think you’ve given your all--
--When you think you can’t keep going--

content.text: BAM! BAM! BAM! Miles is knocked down REPEATEDLY. He LIES ON THE GROUND.
The Spiders watch Miles struggle on the floor. He can’t get up. CONCERNED LOOKS are exchanged.
The Spiders gather in a circle to talk, leaving Miles behind.

dialogue: Peter, come here. You need to be more honest with yourself about this. He’s not ready, it’s obvious.
There’s no way. He’s just a kid.
But if he can’t do this, we have to stay and do it for him.
He’s looking right at us while we talk about him...

content.text: A beat, then Peter looks to where Miles was and realizes--
The elevator is moving UP.

dialogue: See that? He can uh, turn invisible...

content.text: MILES, INVISIBLE, rides the elevator. All the spiders see is the shed doors opening way up in the rafters.
SEQ. 1690 - LOOKING FOR AARON “LFA”
WALKING DOWN THE STREET, despondent. Miles lifts up his phone, checks his messages. We hear his parents message:

dialogue: Miles, what is going on with you? Nobody has heard from you. We don’t know what’s going on. Look, if you’re hiding something from us, you need to come clean. You call me back. Now.
